Oh, my friend. On spring break I once accidentally smoked ONE bowl of weed with some friends that had accidentally gotten mixed with weed. We assumed it was sand, since we were on the beach for break, little did we know that it a bag of coke in our safe managed to spill onto a loose nug or two. Desperate as we were to smoke what little weed was left, we hit the "sandy weed" and the smoke was different. Immediately started feeling euphoric and not coked out, more spacey and an experienced something completely unique.
I'm not inclined to believe a high schooler who still calls weed "kush." Sorry kid, cocaine is way too pricy for some dealer to be just giving it to his clients without telling them or charging them.
Better than waking up to vomit-covered pillows and sheets. Which I definitely haven't done ...

I have a Redbone Coonhound that I rescued, and his personality / needs sounds like they align with yours perfectly. Hounds are easy going, and loyal as can be. They don't require absurd amounts of exercise, but enjoy the outdoors and are happy to accompany you on a jog or trail hike. I would suggest considering that since you sound like you want a low maintenance dog that is easy to train, a GSD might not be as good of a fit as a hound.

I study English in school, and have never come across the word canonically. I looked up the definitions and they tell me the "Definition of canonical 1 : of, relating to, or forming a canon canonical scriptures 2 : conforming to a general rule or acceptable procedure : orthodox His proposals were generally accepted as canonical. 3 : of or relating to a clergyman who is a canon 4 : reduced to the canonical form a canonical matrix canonicallyplay \-k(-)l\ adverb
What am I missing, or is the OP incorrectly using this word?
I have an idea based on the context, but the dictionary isn't helping with its biblical definitions.

Very easy, my friend. My recipe serves 2-4 people.
- 2 Sticks of the best butter you can buy (I use Plugra) - 2 Cups heavy cream - 2 Cups parmesan/asiago cheese - 2-4 Garlic cloves, depending on how much you like garlic - 2 Lemons juiced fresh - Pepper, ample amounts to taste - Salt to taste - 3/4 Shrimp, peeled and devaned - Pasta of your choosing
0) Begin boiling your pasta.
1) In a saucepan melt your butter, then combine your garlic to brown just a bit in the butter.
2) Add your heavy cream to the butter and reduce for 5 minutes or so on low heat. The sauce should reduce but still be runny enough to wiggle in the pan with little effort.
3) Add your cheese, pepper, and salt to the milk/better mixture. Whisk until smooth. Reserve a little cheese for plating.
4) Drain pasta and in another pan quickly sautee the shrimp in some butter with lemon and garlic.
5) Combine drained pasta with the alfredo sauce over low heat.
6) Plate pasta and add shrimp.
Enjoy!
The shrimp were Texas wild-caught locally from the gulf. Delicious.

The ending reads exactly like a novel. "Sometimes I wonder if it was all a dream and my teacher was a ghost" is a lazy way to end a text, but it's done all the time in some fashion. But when I knew it was fake was when the author mysteriously found the gun which was supposed to never be seen again waiting for him at home. Teachers at school would never let a child get away with brining a gun to school, therefore I call BS.

WRITING.TITLE: Favorite character on the Sopranos?
WRITING.TEXT: I'm curious to see which characters everyone can say "he/she's my favorite" amidst such an interesting group. Thoughts? Why?

I would just suggest re-watching the seasons, all of them, once more if you have the time. There area lot of references and plotlines that converge into one amazing, but complex, last season.
As for fan theories, you'll spend at least a half hour searching the web after watching the finale. Enjoy!

The .243 is great all around gun, and especially forgiving of beginners. There is low recoil, but just as much "oomph" and knock-down power to handle almost all North-American game including deer, pigs, varmints, and anything in between. Unless you are in the Canadian/Alaskan bush chasing predators such as bears, or hunting elk, the .243 is a great gun. I recommend a single shot by a reputable brand like CVA with bull barrel that has been shortened for youth.
